text: Đorđije Savov Petrović-Njegoš (Cyrillic: Ђорђије Савов Петровић-Његош) was a Montenegrin vojvoda, politician and president of the Governing senate of Montenegro and the Highlands during the reign of his cousin prince Danilo II."Crnogorski Senat: Zbornik dokumenata (1857-1879)", prired. N. Rajkovic. PODGORICA, CID, 1997.g. Đorđije Savov was known as the wealthiest person of his time in the Old Montenegro. As the member of the ruling House of Petrović- Njegoš, he was vice-president of the governing senate of Montenegro, from 1834 until 1853, when he replaced his cousin Pero Tomov Petrović-Njegoš as the new president. He served as president of the senate until 1857, when he was succeeded by vojvoda Mirko Petrović-Njegoš.J.Jovanovic, Stvaranje Crnogorske drzave i razvoj Crnogorske nacionalnosti, 1947, Obod-Cetinje ==References== Category:People of the Principality of Montenegro Category:Petrović-Njegoš dynasty Category:Prime Ministers of Montenegro Category:Speakers of the Parliament of Montenegro
title: Đorđije Petrović-Njegoš
